channel.title: Jeroen Janssens on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Jeroen Janssens on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: R, me hearties
item.description: I've been fond of maps and graphs for a long time, but haven't had a good set of tools to play with that easily generate decent versions of same from various data sets I've found or accumulated. The small hope is that a little bit of hacking on the right tools will fix this. One of the tools of choice is R, a language for statistics and data analysis. It's tremendously powerful and a bit complicated, but I'm not trying to learn the whole thing; rather, I'm after just the barest minimum so that I can competently generate a scatterplot of data and place it onto a map.

item.title: using "jq" for command line web applications for civic data
item.description: One of the tools that I rediscovered and have been really happy for having done so is “jq”, a command line tool that bills itself as “awk for json”. I’ve been writing awk code since 1985, and some limited subset of it is something that I know really, really well. awk, however, is from the punchcard era, and as such it likes to deal with records that are all on one line each.
